The mass of the missile is: m = 100 kg.
The gravitational acceleration is: g = 10 m/s^2.
The horizontal and vertical accelerations of the missile during curvilinear motion are: a_x and a_y.

conclusion: Calculate the time taken by the missile to reach the altitude of 5000 m: t = sqrt((2 x 5000)/100) = sqrt(100) = 10 s.

conclusion: Calculate the velocity of the missile at the altitude of 5000 m: v_2 = 0 + 100 x 10 = 1000 m/s.

conclusion: Calculate the horizontal acceleration: a_x = 100 x (1/11) = 100/11 m/s^2.

conclusion: Calculate the vertical acceleration: a_y = 100 x sqrt(1 - (1/11)^2) = 100 x sqrt(120/121) = 100 x (10sqrt(12)/11) = 1000sqrt(12)/11 m/s^2.

conclusion: The magnitude of the acceleration is: a_x = (F sin θ)/m = (11000 x (10/11))/100 = 100 m/s^2
